title: EU Reluctant to Impose Oil-Related Tariffs on China and India
summary: The European Union is not ready to slap tariffs on India and China for their continued buying of Russian oil, Reuters has reported, citing unnamed officials from Brussels. The reluctance comes from the EU’s attitude to tariffs, which is one of caution, with tariffs only implemented after “lengthy i…

title: Japan’s JERA Eyes 20-Year LNG Deal With Alaska LNG
summary: JERA is considering joining companies making commitments for purchases of liquefied natural gas from the Alaska LNG project, Reuters has reported, with a preliminary letter of intent mentioning 1 million tons annually over a 20-year period. The developer of the Alaska LNG project, Glenfarne, has be…

title: IEA Prepares to Walk Back Predictions of Peak Oil and Gas Demand
summary: The International Energy Agency, which has repeatedly predicted that global oil demand growth will peak before 2030, has drafted a report admitting that both oil and gas demand are set to continue growing for decades. Bloomberg’s Javier Blas reported the news in a column this week, citing a draft o…

title: Big Oil Cuts Back as $60 Oil Bites
summary: In their first-quarter financial reports this year, Big Oil majors signaled they were doing just fine in a $60-per-barrel oil environment. Spending plans were aggressive, there was no mention of job cuts, and production plans featured the word “growth”. Six months later, with the price of oil still…

title: Disregarding US Sanctions, India Continues to Buy Russian Crude
summary: India continues to buy cheap Russian crude oil, despite being punished for it by the United States, which in August imposed a 50 percent tariff on Indian exports to America, including a 25 percent penalty for importing Russian crude. The US tariffs on India are some of the highest in the world. Cit…

title: Job Cuts Rock Global Oil and Gas Sector
summary: Oil and gas producers worldwide are bracing for a prolonged downturn, with job losses and investment cuts spreading through the industry, according to a new report from Financial Times. ConocoPhillips, Chevron, and BP have all announced large-scale layoffs, while others are shelving or selling proj…

title: Belgium open to softer stance on frozen Russian assets if EU shares risk
summary: Foreign minister warns bloc not to ‘kill the hen laying golden eggs’
